fullText: This likable but only fitfully engaging production of one of Shakespeare's most problematic plays doesn't do much to solve the riddle of 'Cymbeline,' but it does provide a few pleasures along the way.

bwwExcerpt: Daniel Sullivan, the reliably fine director whose Shakespeare productions here usually have avoided self-conscious concepts, has almost made a U-turn with this disappointing staging...Here, the emphasis is somewhat deflatingly on the artifice in "Cymbeline."
